name: Broadway Hotel and Hostel

reviews.text: Just right for our needs. We only wanted a good nights sleep and a clean place to get ready each morning. The location was perfect for getting to the subway blocks away. We felt safe and the neighborhood was friendly and relaxed. The staff of young people were very warm and polite. We enjoyed interacting with the young travelers from Europe. I definitely recommend staying as long as its understood this is a practical hotel for a low cost. Its not extravagant but that is what the city is for. :)
reviews.title: A unique experience for an awesome price.

reviews.text: Did'nt expect much for the price but very impressed. Located in Upper West side just off Broadway - very easy to catch the Subway - generally nice and quite area with great food.
reviews.title: Cheap hotel in Manhatten New York - clean and good value

reviews.text: This place was farther away from things than we thought. Way up on the upper west side. Howvwer it is only a couple of short blocks from the subway. The area is nice and quiet. Reaidential. We came home around 3 am one night and the walk from the subway to the hostel seemed safe.
reviews.title: A bit far but nice quiet area

reviews.text: The rooms have a bunk bed, lockers and a sink. It was nice for two of us as it was like having a private room. The bathrooms are shared. I did wish the rooms had a table or a chair. There's plety of room.
reviews.title: Good and Bad-can't decide if I would return

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and the shared bathrooms were sometimes clean. My big complaint is that they clean the bathrooms at 7 or 8 in the morning and its loud. I wasn't in new york to sleep but it still wouldve been nice if they waited until later.
reviews.title: Nice - But a complete rip off

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights following a business trip elsewhere in the states. The hostel was easy to find, handily positioned near a metro stop and in a nice area. The hostel itself was great. It is clearly newly refurbished and the amenities downstairs were top draw for a hostel. The room was nice, clean and well appointed with a sink, flat screen TV and an iPod dock (assuming unlike me you have one). The beds were comfy if a little creaky! But I had a great nights sleep both nights. The bathrooms were out in the hall, but kept very clean all day. I loved the place and hope to be back at some time in the future hopefully!
reviews.title: Simply great
Double booked on first night of stay
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on the 2nd Oct 2011 for a stay on the 10th Dec 2011 for 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel in the evening after a long day of travelling, only to be told that they were fully booked for the first night. They offered for us stay the first night at one of their sister hotels then come back to the hotel for the following 3 nights. I told them we were not prepared to spend the little time that we had in NYC, moving from one hotel to another. They eventually found a room at their sister hotel for the whole stay. Cannot run a knees up in a brewery springs to mind!

I stayed in a hostel room shared with another person. I just needed a room to sleep in as I was going to be out the whole day. The bedroom was pretty clean. The bathroom was very clean and maintained clean. So that is great. The staff were friendly and nice and quite helpful. I am very glad that they took note of my request. I booked a mixed dorm hostel room but I requested for a female roommate and they placed me with one. :) It is just too bad the internet was only in the common room and the internet was very slow. But overall it was a great value for a clean place.
reviews.title: Great price for hostel room

reviews.text: I stayed in the hostel portion of this place in a two bed per room reservation. The room was dark and somewhat cold with a sink and a locker. There are bathrooms down the hall which for me were always clean and open 95% of the time.
reviews.title: Works for the price

reviews.text: The staff were all very nice, friendly and helpful. I was cold and kept asking for more blankets, and they gladly gave me as many as I needed. They were not able to control the heat though, so even though the room was chilly, they could not improve it. We had a snowstorm one day, and even then the heaters did not kick into a higher heat, but at least we had power. I heard all of the East coast lost power and thousands were without ANY heat, so I was grateful to have any heat and my six blankets. :-) I also like to be very warm when I sleep, so that's just me.
reviews.title: Good price for Manhattan but poor place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What we needed - a room for 2 nights stay, close to center and metro, soft bed and cheap accommodation in New York. And we got it! Very nice staff who kept a big box for us for a week. Helpful. Internet was only downstairs and very slow. The common WC was clean and free all the time (don't know why) =)
reviews.title: our broadway stay

reviews.text: For a budget youth hostel it's probably fine. I haven't seen the dorm rooms so I can't say for sure. I stayed in a double bed private room with bathroom, and it was disappointing & so far from the description on the website. At $200 a night, it is a complete rip-off.
reviews.title: What a dump

reviews.text: I chose it because it was near to the meetings I needed to go to in Morningside, but I should have simply commuted from a different hotel (I've stayed at one in hell's kitchen, the french quarters, which is way better and the same price!).
reviews.title: never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was ok in both cleanliness and size, but no place to hang clothes, hallway has an odd smell, bathroom floor was sticky, carpet dingy, A/C quite loud, no radio, phone, or iron in the room.
reviews.title: Very clean, comfortable beds, great location
BROADWAY Hotel owes a school group a REFUND of more than $5 000 after cancelling their FULLY paid accommodation
reviews.text: Room was too small, squalid and dirty, the bed and the bathroom door were broken. It was noisy all the time and the air conditioner seemed to explode. The service was not the best and the staff not friendly and we paid about 200 dollars per night, what an impudence!

My mother and I stayed here in December when we came down from CT for an opera. It is much better than your typical hostel (and I've hostelled all over Europe) and is more like the type of budget hotel I typically stay at in Europe but hardly exists here in the US. Our room was very simple, but we were happy to have 2 beds, a TV, shelves, towels, a sink, and shampoo! Again, most hostels do NOT offer these things. The room was toasty warm. An old-style elevator is cool but there is no reason not to use the stairs, it is good exercise. The reception was EXTREMELY friendly and it's great to have a fridge to store food in. We didn't see anyone else using the bathroom on our floor and it was perfectly clean and spacious. The negative review here is clearly from someone who lacks experience staying in hostels. This one is above average.
reviews.title: Great deal, perfect for our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel/hostel was great for the price. This was my first time in New York and in a hostel, so I really didn't know what to expect. I booked a private room with a private bathroom for about $120 a night.
reviews.title: Awesome in NY for the Price

reviews.text: The room and bathroom were both perfectly clean and comfortable. Plenty enough room for two people in the queen bed. There was a lounge area that was nice, and the staff were very helpful. Short walk to both subway and bus.
reviews.title: hostel? more like dog house

reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again- awesome price and cool location in New York!
reviews.title: Hostel?! I've stayed in worse hotels!!

reviews.text: never in my whole life have i stayed in a place as bad and as un-welcoming, what we got there with friends i cried my eyes out for hours wanting to be home again! it was dirty and no clean towels were given to us at all for 5 days, we had to ask for them. also we shared a bath room with the whole floor which was 6 people and is was dirty and hairy and never cleaned! i went in my friends instead, which was in fact several floors above me, there was people all over the place when i got out i felt crap walking past them!and was always frezing cold where it took you breath away,
reviews.title: great prices and great place!

description: Broadway Hotel & Hostel is situated on the trendy Upper West Side. we offer clean, comfortable, and, most importantly, affordable New York City discount hotel rooms. A 15-minute ride from the heart of Times Square! Designed to satisfy even the smallest travel budgets, our chic yet inexpensive hotel provides wonderful value, in a colorful setting.
